title: Mueller Report finds 140+ contacts between Trump campaign and Russians
summary:
The Mueller Report documented at least 140 contacts between Trump and 18 associates with
Russian nationals and WikiLeaks during the 2016 campaign and transition. The report found
Russian interference was "sweeping and systematic" and violated U.S. criminal law. While
establishing "multiple links" between the Trump campaign and Russia, Mueller did not find
sufficient evidence of criminal conspiracy. None of the 140+ contacts were reported to
authorities, and the Trump team attempted to cover up every single one.

sources.title: What The Mueller Report Says About The Trump Campaign's Russian Contacts
Key Findings of the Mueller Report
The Mueller Report Shows All the Bizarre Ways Russia Reached Out to the Trump Campaign

notes:
The Moscow Project documented 272 total contacts including 38 meetings. The report detailed
Russian efforts through the Internet Research Agency's social media campaign and GRU hacking
of Democratic emails. Multiple Trump associates made false statements about these contacts
and obstructed investigations.
